thread.title: Rio Tinto reduces iron ore targets
thread.title_full: Rio Tinto reduces iron ore targets

title: Rio Tinto reduces iron ore targets
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Jul 16, 2015, 12:53 BST - UK Markets close in 3 hrs 37 mins Rio Tinto reduces iron ore targets By Victoria Young | Sharecast â€“ 23 minutes ago 44.835 +0.640 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Australian miner Rio Tinto (LSE: RIO.L - news ) scaled back its iron ore targets, citing weather disruption as impacting production. In a second quarter update, Rio Tinto said iron ore production was 9% higher compared to the same quarter in 2014 and 7% above the first quarter of 2015. 
However, the FTSE 100 company cut its forecast for first-half shipments by about 7Mt. 
Rio Tinto expected 2015 global shipments of 340Mt from its operations in Australia and Canada. This was down from an earlier forecast of 250Mt. 
Societe Generale (Paris: FR0000130809 - news ) said second-quarter production was in line with its estimates and the drop in forecasts was anticipated. 
Equity analyst Alain Williams held a target price of 3,100p on the stock and said risks could include lower-than-expected commodity prices and higher-than-expected operating costs. 
RBC Capital Markets held a 'sector perform' rating on the mining stock and a target price of 2,597p. 
It said the iron ore guidance downgrade was not a surprise. 
In a note, Credit Suisse (NYSE: CS - news ) held a 'neutral' rating and said Rio Tinto would struggle to grow US dividends in the next four yields. 
Shares (Frankfurt: DI6.F - news ) in Rio Tinto were down 0.27% at 0804 BST to 2590p
